content.webTitle: Pick of the week: Rock and pop

fields.headline: Pick of the week: Rock and pop
fields.bodyText: Van Morrison Audley End House, Saffron Walden Saturday 2 Top-notch Celtic soul from Van The Man, currently basking in a reissue programme of his career highlights. Curmudgeonly greatness throughout. Young Knives Wulfrun Hall, Wolverhampton Saturday 2 The tweedy Ronnie Barker lookalikes play sharp and sparky post-punk. As if Mitchell and Webb were a band, only fractionally louder. Acid Mothers Temple And The Cosmic Inferno Clwb Ifor Bach, Cardiff Sunday 3 The Japanese psychedelic band bring over utterly hairy, often thrilling free-noise rock, as recommended by Julian Cope. Calvin Johnson The Cube Microplex, Bristol Monday 4 Washington DC-based label entrepreneur and former Beat Happening man Johnson performs faux-naïf songs, in an ominous baritone. Reverend Horton Heat Bar Academy, Oxford, Monday 4; Rescue Rooms, Nottingham, Tuesday 5; Astoria 2, London, Wednesday 6 The Reverend Jim and his band with their enduringly feisty hard rockabilly.
